definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Group messaging is also going to be vastly improved.
sentences.chinese: 羣發短信功能也將大加改善。

sentences.english: But can there be any sense in texting toddlers?
sentences.chinese: 但是，這對於向小孩發短信有意義嗎？

sentences.english: Usually, teenagers only use their phone for texting, calling.
sentences.chinese: 通常，青少年只用手機來發短信，和通話。

sentences.english: Some people will text message friends or watch videos on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 有些人立馬給朋友發短信或是在線看片。

sentences.english: She's texting too and occasionally nodding off.
sentences.chinese: 她還在一邊發短信，偶爾打個盹。

sentences.english: I live in a place where they've recently banned the use of mobile phones while driving, with additional penalties for texting.
sentences.chinese: 在我住的地方開車時你不能打手機，發短信也會加罰。

sentences.english: textPlus, a mobile app, offers users free texting with group text capability.
sentences.chinese: 一項手機應用，提供給用戶免費的羣發短信功能。

sentences.english: The so-called boyfriend sent information, uggs kids, called phone.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的男朋友發短信，打電話。

sentences.english: Almost every day, they had exchanged text messages.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每天他們都在互發短信。

sentences.english: Obama has already banned texting while driving for federal workers.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬已經禁止聯邦工作人員在開車時發短信。

sentences.english: But I'll take TMI over black lungs any day.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我寧願發短信發到手軟，也不願染上黑肺病。

sentences.english: Kids texted an average of four people a night.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們平均一個晚上給4個人發短信。

sentences.english: The truth is that it is not necessarily unsafe to text behind the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 真相是駕車時發短信並不必然危險。

sentences.english: How did you let people know to call or text message “4636″?
sentences.chinese: 你如何讓人們知道打電話或者發短信給“4636”？

sentences.english: But she uses her knuckles to text on a mobile phone.
sentences.chinese: 不過，她發短信用的是指關節。

sentences.english: He’s received text messages from listeners cautioning him to be careful of what he says on the air.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆發短信告訴他，要他當心自己在節目中說的話。

definition: newsletter/the news in brief/(Tw) SMS message
to press charges/to file a complaint
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
